channel.title: Is windows 7 worth using?
channel.description:
I've been trying to figure out if I should try windows 7 out or not
Is it better than Vista.
Should I backup my files before hand?

item.title: Is windows 7 worth using?
item.dc:creator: Crunchy
item.description:
Here’s the thing. You cannot upgrade the release candidate to the full version. So unless you want to have a somewhat dysfunctional OS starting in March, then you either need to do a clean install of either Vista or Windows 7 (if you buy it) at that time. There are ways to get around this (assuming you want to keep vista installed), but I am not going to explain them here. So, if you are competent with installing/repairing operating systems and you want to give it a try, go for it. From my experience Windows 7 performs better than Vista, but not enough that I would recommend novices to make the switch by themselves. Yes you would want to back up your data. You always want to back up your data.

Read full topic
